alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 11:14PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pittsylvania, southwestern Bedford and northeastern Franklin Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Moneta, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount... Moneta... Penhook... Northwest Smith Mountain Lake... Westlake Corner... Southern Smith Mountain Lake... and Sago. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Smith Mountain Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
